ba8735eb-4835-49cd-8ac1-1892d7105e68.content: {Convergence to a previous state in an indeterministic world would require a remarkable coincidence of chance events, which is termed a quasi-miracle.}, {If convergence requires a quasi-miracle, it implies that such events are extraordinarily improbable and not typical of our world.}

0aa7e104-3dee-4f27-b754-1f17b4815107.content: {Counterfactual dependence is asymmetric, with the future depending on the present but not vice versa}, {This asymmetry is explained by the asymmetry of miracles, where divergence requires a small miracle and convergence requires a large one}, {The asymmetry of miracles is due to the asymmetry of overdetermination, where the past is overdetermined by the future more than the future is by the past}

71f8c79b-8134-4d0b-b1a3-bf3090f7f3b2.content: {Counterfactuals are true if the closest possible world where the antecedent is true also makes the consequent true}, {The similarity of worlds is determined by a system of weights prioritizing the avoidance of large miracles, perfect match of particular facts, and avoidance of small miracles}, {Perfect match of particular facts is more important than approximate match, and avoiding large miracles is more important than avoiding small ones}

6309d3bd-e648-4780-bd7f-6772c34a7401.content: {In indeterministic worlds, divergence does not require a miracle, but convergence requires a quasi-miracle}, {A quasi-miracle is a remarkable coincidence of chance events that detracts from similarity like a genuine miracle}, {Quasi-miracles are extraordinarily improbable and not typical of our world}

e34532c1-c5c1-429c-abbe-40be5879090c.summary: Do quasi-miracles detract from similarity like genuine miracles?
e34532c1-c5c1-429c-abbe-40be5879090c.content: {Quasi-miracles, despite being lawful, are such remarkable coincidences that they are unlike typical events in our world, thus detracting from similarity.}, {If quasi-miracles detract from similarity, they should not occur in the closest possible worlds to ours, where events unfold naturally without such coincidences.}

ee055859-55ac-4c87-abaa-c4daf0b824d3.summary: Counterfactual Dependence with Asymmetry of Miracles
ee055859-55ac-4c87-abaa-c4daf0b824d3.content: {Counterfactuals are true if the antecedent leads to the consequent in the most similar possible worlds}, {The similarity of worlds is determined by avoiding big, widespread, diverse violations of law}, {Perfect match of particular fact is prioritized over approximate match}, {Small, localized, simple violations of law are less significant than big ones}, {Quasi-miracles, despite being lawful, detract from similarity like genuine miracles}

d9b77e2c-795f-489c-814d-3cffcfc28566.summary: Counterfactual Dependence with Asymmetry of Quasi-Miracles
d9b77e2c-795f-489c-814d-3cffcfc28566.content: {Counterfactuals are true if the antecedent leads to the consequent in the most similar possible worlds}, {The similarity of worlds is determined by avoiding big, widespread, diverse violations of law}, {Perfect match of particular fact is prioritized over approximate match}, {Small, localized, simple violations of law are less significant than big ones}, {Quasi-miracles, despite being lawful, detract from similarity like genuine miracles}, {Quasi-miracles are extraordinary coincidences that are unlike typical events in our world}
